alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 3:45PM EDT until July 04 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Morris County in northern New Jersey... Southeastern Sussex County in northwestern New Jersey... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 345 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Ogdensburg, or 9 miles east of Newton, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Dover, Hopatcong, Boonton, Wharton, Rockaway, Mount Arlington, Franklin, Mountain Lakes, Stanhope, Netcong, Ogdensburg, Victory Gardens, Lake Mohawk, Succasunna, Succasunna-Kenvil, Lake Telemark, Green Pond, Budd Lake and White Meadow Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 27 and 42. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 43 and 47. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
